channel.title: Should i host or release my project?
channel.description: should i host or release my 1st project? Any idea?? Hahaha :P random!

item.title: Should i host or release my project?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Smallboy, post:4, topic:409457”]Yes i am , you are from ?[/quote]Rix_ is from Singapore too :O!

OT - If it’s a RSPS, it doesn’t belong in this section Server Downloads is where you put those. If it’s just a general Java project, feel free to post it here. You can (usually) get some good critique.

Read full topic
item.source: Should i host or release my project?

item.title: Should i host or release my project?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Javerfire:

you might as well host it, due to the leeching problem. But also you may want to post a development/show off thread.

I lol at how people still complain about leeching. You release the source why the fuck complain about people using it? People are going to host it with a few changes anyways, plus every server that Ive played that I know the person complains about it being leeched after, I didn’t see them giving any credits any were on their forums or in the server? So… Yeah… A little rant…

This topic also isn’t allowed any where… It’s really up to you whether you release it or host it…

Read full topic

item.title: Should i host or release my project?
item.dc:creator: @Smallboy Smallboy
item.description:
@Smallboy wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:3, topic:409457”]It’s really up to you. Assuming that you are talking about an RS2 emulator, by all means, go ahead. You can do it for the money.

Anyways, before you post a thread, you might want to ensure it is relevant to the board you are posting in. Otherwise, see if it’s allowed. In this case the thread here is generally frowned upon.

p/s: Are you from Singapore?[/quote]
Yes i am , you are from ?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

It’s really up to you. Assuming that you are talking about an RS2 emulator, by all means, go ahead. You can do it for the money.

Anyways, before you post a thread, you might want to ensure it is relevant to the board you are posting in. Otherwise, see if it’s allowed. In this case the thread here is generally frowned upon.

p/s: Are you from Singapore?
